subject: Programming
title: The Excel Error That Rocked Economics
description: A quick win: understand The Excel Error That Rocked Economics.

hook.text: In 2010, two Harvard economists published a paper that influenced austerity policies worldwide.

buildup.text: Reinhart and Rogoff claimed high national debt always crushed economic growth.

discovery.text: A grad student found they had accidentally excluded five countries from their Excel formula.

twist.text: The corrected data showed no clear debt threshold. The original conclusion was wrong.

climax.text: Governments had already cut budgets based on the flawed paper, affecting millions of people.

punchline.text: A spreadsheet mistake shaped global economic policy.

quiz.question: What error did the Reinhart-Rogoff paper contain?
options: Countries excluded from an Excel formula
